FuncDef:
The active port-bras command activates the BRAS access function on interfaces.
The undo active port-bras command deactivates the BRAS access function on interfaces.
By default, the BRAS access function is not activated on interfaces.
CLIs: undo active port-bras slot <slot-id> card <card-id> [ port <port-list> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the subcard ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 31.

Specifies a list of interfaces. Interface IDs are separated by, or -.
The value is a string of 1 to 256 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: Info: Use the display command to check the activation status of the port-bras licenses after committing the command.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To allow Layer 2 and Layer 3 IPoE (DHCP, static, and leased-line) users, PPPoE users to access the network from interfaces, run the active port-bras command in the license view to activate the BRAS access function.
Prerequisites
 The license file on the master main control board has been activated by running the license active <file-name> command. Interface-specific basic hardware licenses have been activated by running the active port-basic slot <slot-id> card <card-id> port <port-list> command.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only on the admin VS.
Before running the bas command to create a BAS interface on the GE and Eth-Trunk interface, you must run the active port-bras command to activate the BRAS access function on the interface.
The active port-bras command applies only to interfaces on an LPUI-240-CM (24 x 10GE)/LPUI-120-CM (12 x 10GE)/LPUI-120-CM (6 x 10GE+24GE)/LPUI-51-CM (48GE)/LPUI-480-CM (4 x 100GE)/LPUI-480-CM (48 x 10GE)/LPUI-480-CM (2x 100GE+24 x 10GE)/LPUI-1T-CM (16 x 50GE/8 x 100GE)/LPUI-1T-CM (32 x 25GE)/LPUI-242-CM-(24*10GE).
